titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States regarding citizenship in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.
Joint Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on the Constitution and by the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 5/3/1995--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Grants U.S. citizenship to only those persons: (1) born to a parent who is a U.S. citizen; (2) born within the United States to a parent lawfully in and subject to the jurisdiction of the United States at the time of that parents' entry into the United States; and (3) naturalized according to U.S. law. Sets forth provisions relating to: (1) restrictions on services or payments to non-U.S. citizens; (2) English language requirement for naturalization; and (3) apportionment of Representatives based on number of citizens of each State.
